content.description: Start just to the right of three white lights on a somewhat confusing slab. Work your way into the prominent dihedral up to rap rigs.
content.location: Starts right where Lyle and Jessica pronounced their undying love of 2015 (thanks, guys!)

content.description: Variation of over the rainbow that goes straight up. Another obvious line that's probably been done but not listed for some reason. Doable purely on gear but not really worth the risk IMHO (PG13 if you're so inclined).Clip the first bolt and quest up under the roof. Be sure to plug some gear to protect the reachy traverse right and mantle (crux?). Fun moves up the dihedral to the topout. Try not to touch the suspect block.
content.protection: Standard Rack. Gear anchor (bring a couple extra smaller pieces).
content.location: Same start as Over the Rainbow.

content.description: A pretty obvious, natural line that has undoubtedly been climbed many times over. Super nice with an excellent variety of moves and just enough exposure to keep it fun. Protects very well. Crux is the thin finger crack in the middle. do NOT get fooled into trying to jam a 0.5 C4 into there... you might regret it. A pretty good option for someone breaking into the grade.
content.location: Starts equidistance between Flying Monkeys and Over the Rainbow. A squeeze but the line is just so obvious and the movement so nice, it's too much of a bummer to not mention it.

content.description: Super fun route with a challenging roof. Start on the slabby wall to the right of the roof section. Once you get to the roof work left and move up through the crux to get above the roof. Shoulder length runners are recommended for all of the roof bolts. Easy climbing from there to rap rings.
content.location: Look for the obvious roof. Its the first of the bolted lines.

content.description: Mixed route. The start is not exceptionally difficult but protecting it is challenging. The first bolt is very high but if you are feeling frisky..... Fairly straightforward line. The original developer doesn't care if another bolt is added so leave a comment if you think it needs a bolt at the start or if we should keep the thrill.
content.protection: Nuts to protect the start. 2 bolts to chain anchors at the top.
content.location: Right of Gin and Juice (look for the small roof).

content.description:
Starts under overhang, funky body positioning gets you through that crux up to ledge, 15 feet up and finish on the plethora of cracks and pro placements.

 Cracks up top to set an anchor, small cams. We stationed a standard rap line off of gear. You can walk off/down climb to the right.
content.location: To the left, first larger wall approached from climbing area. Left of currently established bolted lines.

climbs.name: Over the Rainbow
climbs.fa: Micheal and Ashley Thackra, Aarons Collins

content.description: Starts in a v shaped dihedral to bolt, head left to a 2nd and 3rd bolt. You will need a shoulder length runner for the 3rd and forth bolt to prevent any rope drag. After clipping the third bolt down climb around the corner to the 4th bolt,then climb the opposing dihedrals to the achors passing 3 more bolts.
content.protection: 7 bolts to rap rings   7 QDs   2 Alpine draws for 3rd and 4th bolt
content.location: Starts left of a lone shrub 15'or so back from the rock.

content.description: Start just to the left of the family rock. Fun hand cracks and easy footwork.
content.protection: Set of nuts and midsize cams. Chain anchors at the top.
content.location: Just to the left of Forrest

content.description: Easy trad line. Start to the left of Gin and Juice and follow the crack line up the dihedral.
content.protection: Set of nuts and midsize cams. Chain anchors at the top.
content.location: Left of Gin and Juice (look for the small roof).

content.description: Start at a small roof and pick your poison (either going slightly left, slightly right or straight up the middle) to get past the small roof. Its advisable to try and remove your first draw once you get the second in to reduce rope drag (a runner would make the bolt useless since its very low).  Find your way through some interesting holds to the crux just before the anchors.
To the right of Wicked Witch of the West. Easy climbing except for a huge step up toward the start. Work your way into the dihedral that the 3 routes share.
Awesome route! Start at the family rock (you'll know it when you see it.....thanks to the local talent). Work up through the dihedral using fun pockets to rap rings.

Route just to the right of the overhang Shatless route. Goes up various cracks to a ledge and little dihedral and then up to the top. Easy pro, most vertical of the three.

 Cracks up top to set an anchor, small cams. We stationed a standard rap line off of gear. You can walk off/down climb to the right.
content.location: To the left, first larger wall approached from climbing area. Left of currently established bolted lines.

content.description:
Directly above the "Shelley" tag is an arete with anchors at the top. I can hardly believe it isnt a climb, but since it isnt listed on this page I will assume I put it up. It goes on gear but placements are very specific and options are limited making this feel a bit exciting. 

 Climb straight up through the "She" and stem past the datura plant. Continue up the blunt arete, staying out of the crack to the left.Â
content.protection: BD 1-4, a good variety of C3 sized cams, and small nuts (brass offsets were particularly useful).

content.description: South facing Malapai cliff face. Great crag with some super fun lines! It's climbable through the winter as long as it's sunny and through the summer except on the hottest days. Mostly trad or top rope but more sport routes to come.
